intro: Bryonia subpinnata, commonly known as the common bryony, is a climbing plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons. The plant has thick, fleshy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, followed by orange to red berries that contain toxic seeds. The plant is characterized by its strong, prickly tendrils and is often found in disturbed soils and hedgerows.
